entry.content:
The new Labor government in Australia is showing that it wants to distance itself from the more extravagant excesses of the left: [Government forms have been changed to replace the term "birthing parent" with "mother".](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2022/jul/21/bill-shorten-intervenes-to-remove-birthing-parent-from-medical-forms-amid-criticism-in-daily-telegraph)
It's not a big deal, just a few words on a form. But it's a clear indication - along with other moves, such as their point blank refusal to entertain lifting their emissions reduction targets - that Albanese's government, for now at least, wants to continue the moderate, centrist approach that won them power rather than giving their progressive supporters everything they want.
It's also a further indication that a left wing party that is serious about winning and holding power sees pro-trans language as a loser. There were attempts by the former government to invoke trans culture war issues to their advantage during the campaign - and while the media was successfully baited into an outrage campaign, Labor steadfastly did not bite.
